lines.content: Welcome to **Bob the Chat Bot**! Bob helps you **keep track of tasks, deadlines, and events** effortlessly.
- üìñ View and manage your task list
- üíæ **Data persistence** ‚Äì your tasks are saved automatically!
A To-Do task is a simple task without any specific date/time.
A deadline is a task that must be completed before a specific time.
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è for information on supported date formats, see the corresponding [section](#-supported-date-formats) below
An event is a task that has a specific **start and end** date/time.
event <event description> /from <event start date/time> /to <event end date/time>
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è for information on supported date formats, see the corresponding [section](#-supported-date-formats) below
To **see all tasks** in your list, use:
Once you finish a task, mark it as done.
If you accidentally marked a task wrongly, you can unmark the task as done.
To remove a task from your list, use:
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è the find function returns any corresponding matches, it does not have to be the full word. Even a letter can be used to find corresponding tasks containing that letter.
Bob **automatically saves your tasks** when you exit.
> Alternatively, simply close the window by presing 'X' on the top right corner.
Bob **saves your tasks automatically** to `data/bob.txt`. When you reopen Bob, your tasks will be restored.
You can use various date formats such as:
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è if the time is not specified, it will set it as the current time you added the task, on the date you entered.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è some dates, especially in natural language may be inferred wrongly, especially if the date is not a valid day of the month. Bob will still try to infer which date you are referring to, but it can get it wrong. If the date inferred is incorrect, simply delete and add the task again using a different date format.
2. Simply double click to run and start adding tasks! üéâ
> _**Note:** This documentation was generated with assistance from ChatGPT for better styling._

Welcome to **Bob the Chat Bot**! Bob helps you **keep track of tasks, deadlines, and events** effortlessly.
- üìñ View and manage your task list
- üíæ **Data persistence** ‚Äì your tasks are saved automatically!
A To-Do task is a simple task without any specific date/time.
A deadline is a task that must be completed before a specific time.
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è for information on supported date formats, see the corresponding [section](#-supported-date-formats) below
An event is a task that has a specific **start and end** date/time.
event <event description> /from <event start date/time> /to <event end date/time>
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è for information on supported date formats, see the corresponding [section](#-supported-date-formats) below
To **see all tasks** in your list, use:
Once you finish a task, mark it as done.
If you accidentally marked a task wrongly, you can unmark the task as done.
To remove a task from your list, use:
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è the find function returns any corresponding matches, it does not have to be the full word. Even a letter can be used to find corresponding tasks containing that letter.
Bob **automatically saves your tasks** when you exit.
> Alternatively, simply close the window by presing 'X' on the top right corner.
Bob **saves your tasks automatically** to `data/bob.txt`. When you reopen Bob, your tasks will be restored.
You can use various date formats such as:
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è if the time is not specified, it will set it as the current time you added the task, on the date you entered.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è some dates, especially in natural language may be inferred wrongly, especially if the date is not a valid day of the month. Bob will still try to infer which date you are referring to, but it can get it wrong. If the date inferred is incorrect, simply delete and add the task again using a different date format.
2. Simply double click to run and start adding tasks! üéâ
> _**Note:** This documentation was generated with assistance from ChatGPT for better styling._

String input = "[T][ ] Buy groceries"; // Valid Todo task
Task task = Parser.parseTask(input); // Parsing the task
assertInstanceOf(Todo.class, task); // Verify that the parsed task is of type Todo
assertEquals("Buy groceries", task.toString().substring(7)); // Ensure the description is correct
String input = "[D][ ] Submit assignment (by: 2025-01-31 23:59)"; // Valid Deadline task
Task task = Parser.parseTask(input); // Parsing the task
assertInstanceOf(Deadline.class, task); // Verify that the parsed task is of type Deadline
.substring(7, task.toString().indexOf(" (by:"))); // Ensure the description is correct

assertNotNull(result); // Ensure that the result is not null
assertEquals(2025, result.getYear()); // Check if the year is correct
assertEquals(1, result.getMonthValue()); // Check if the month is correct
assertEquals(31, result.getDayOfMonth()); // Check if the day is correct
String validDateWithTime = "2025-01-31 14:30"; // Valid date and time format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm)
LocalDateTime result = Parser.parseDate(validDateWithTime); // Parsing the date with time
assertNotNull(result); // Ensure that the result is not null
assertEquals(2025, result.getYear()); // Check if the year is correct
assertEquals(1, result.getMonthValue()); // Check if the month is correct
assertEquals(31, result.getDayOfMonth()); // Check if the day is correct
assertEquals(14, result.getHour()); // Check if the hour is correct
assertEquals(30, result.getMinute()); // Check if the minute is correct
